DataElement.preferredName: SDH Gene Mutation Protein Subunit Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The specified subunit in the succinate dehydrogenase (SDH) complex where the gene mutation occurs.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: SDH Complex Gene Mutation Protein Subunit
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A change in the nucleotide sequence of any gene that encodes one of the proteins in the succinate dehydrogenase (SDH) complex._A polypeptide chain that associates with itself or at least one other chain to form a functional protein or protein complex.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A change in the nucleotide sequence of any gene that encodes one of the proteins in the succinate dehydrogenase (SDH) complex.

Concepts.definition: A change in the nucleotide sequence of any gene that encodes one of the proteins in the succinate dehydrogenase (SDH) complex.

Property.preferredDefinition: A polypeptide chain that associates with itself or at least one other chain to form a functional protein or protein complex.

Concepts.definition: A polypeptide chain that associates with itself or at least one other chain to form a functional protein or protein complex.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of a protein or other product. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for NCI-INC0538595 20C0161 Exon and codon request. 11.17.2020 mc
